decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. It also includes versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Cabal Therapy to control the board. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain card advantage with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. With a mix of powerful threats and disruptive spells, this deck aims to maintain a high tempo and pressure the opponent into making mistakes.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on achieving a fast and aggressive win by utilizing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, Gurmag Angler, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer. With a strong mix of card draw and disruption spells like Ponder, Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, Daze, Force of Will, Lightning Bolt, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to pressure opponents while also maintaining control of the game. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana needed for the spells in the deck.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption while generating card advantage through card draw effects like Brainstorm and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It maintains control of the board using versatile creatures like Baleful Strix and Deathrite Shaman, alongside powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope. The mana base is designed to support the deck's diverse color requirements, allowing for maximum flexibility in spell-casting. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and out-control the opponent to secure victory.

The deck revolves around quickly generating mana with Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while utilizing cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to untap creatures and continue the combo. Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order are used to tutor for key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-ending swing. Glimpse of Nature provides card draw, while Nettle Sentinel and Elvish Visionary help keep the deck's momentum going. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large board of Elves and finish them off with a powerful attack.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats such as Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting their game plan with cards like Stifle, Daze, and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Bitterblossom while also providing card selection and mana fixing with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe. By utilizing a mix of tempo plays and aggressive creatures, this deck looks to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on attacking the opponent quickly and efficiently while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction. The deck relies on cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to clear the way for aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. Additionally, the deck uses Deathrite Shaman for mana acceleration and graveyard disruption. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their resources, ultimately overwhelming them before they can establish a strong board presence.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a mix of disruption spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Hymn to Tourach, while also utilizing efficient removal like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck combines powerful threats like Tarmogoyf, Leovold, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to apply pressure and generate card advantage. The mana base is streamlined with a focus on maximizing resource denial with Wasteland and Deathrite Shaman. The deck seeks to control the game tempo while gradually wearing down the opponent's resources to secure victory.

This deck is focused on disrupting and controlling the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, counter magic, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. The key strategy is to gradually grind down the opponent's resources while maintaining card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides additional disruption while also drawing cards, and True-Name Nemesis is a resilient threat that can close out games quickly. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the synergy between various Elf creatures and spells to quickly ramp up mana production and generate card advantage through triggers like Glimpse of Nature. By efficiently casting spells like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, players can quickly search for key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth to assemble a lethal combo and overwhelm the opponent with a massive attack. The inclusion of cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger allow for additional versatility and protection, making this deck a powerful and dynamic force in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. It aims to control the board with cheap removal spells and counter magic, while quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck's mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler and Deathrite Shaman give it a proactive approach to winning the game swiftly. The combination of efficient spells and creatures allows for a versatile and aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by combining the lands Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, with potential assistance from cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress while also using cards like Pithing Needle to control the board. Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal provide mana acceleration, allowing for a fast and powerful win condition through the Dark Depths combo. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Karakas for added versatility and protection.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana-producing artifacts like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, in order to cast a high-impact spell like Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes various cantrips and card draw spells to help find the combo pieces needed to go off, as well as disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo from disruption by the opponent.

This deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures using Cloudpost and other mana acceleration cards. The key strategy is to generate large amounts of colorless mana early in the game to cast devastating threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with big creatures and efficient mana production.

The main focus of this deck is to be aggressive and proactive, utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler along with disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy to establish board control and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to control the game through disruption while attacking with evasive threats and utilizing its mana denial with cards like Wasteland to keep the opponent on the back foot and finish the game quickly.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to effectively control the game through utilizing powerful control spells such as Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Council's Judgment. The deck focuses on manipulating the opponent's board state with cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict, while also maintaining card advantage with Brainstorm, Predict, and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes Back to Basics to disrupt opponents' mana bases and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to generate value and ultimately secure victory through efficient control of the game.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early disruption and aggressive creature threats to put pressure on the opponent while keeping them off balance with counterspells and land destruction. It aims to control the pace of the game with cards like Stifle, Force of Will, and Daze, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt for direct damage. The deck also includes strong creature threats like Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, and Delver of Secrets to quickly close out the game once the opponent's defenses are down.
